article.headline: DePaul 72, Creighton 57
article.story: ROSEMONT, Ill. (AP) -- Wilson Chandler scored 17 points and Sammy Mejia added 15 to lead DePaul to a 72-57 victory over Creighton Wednesday night. DePaul, which led 25-23 at the half, outscored Creighton 7-0 to start the second half. Jabari Currie hit a 3-pointer and had a layup to give the Blue Demons a 32-23 lead. Leading 36-32 midway through the second half, DePaul (2-2) extended their lead on a 11-0 run. Creighton (3-1) entered the game hitting 24-of-48 of their 3-pointer attempts, but was just 5-for-29 Wednesday. Nate Funk, who scored a career-high 38 points for Creighton against Dayton on Saturday, scored 13 points. He left the game with 2:15 left and did not return when he dove for a loose ball and injured his left shoulder. Anthony Tolliver added 17 points and eight rebounds for Creighton. Karron Clarke added 10 points for DePaul. Both teams struggled offensively in the first half, DePaul had 13 turnovers and Creighton shot 32 percent. Chandler scored eight points to lead DePaul in the first half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
